body.pretty: ⊢ ((c0 ∈ On ∧ c1 ∈ On)→(suc(c0)= suc(c1)↔ c0 = c1))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wb(wceq(csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))

comment: Two natural numbers are equal iff their successors are equal, i.e. the successor function is one-to-one. One of Peano's five postulates for arithmetic. Proposition 7.30(4) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 43. (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-2003.)
